title: Lowest F-gases Emissions from Industrial Processes
description: In 2023, Zambia recorded one of the lowest F-gases emissions from industrial processes globally, with a value of just 0.0001 Mt CO2e.

title: Negative Risk Premium on Lending
description: In 2020, Zambia had a negative risk premium on lending, with a rate of -11.32%, indicating favorable lending conditions compared to treasury bill rates.

title: Low Coverage of Social Insurance Programs in Richest Quintile
description: As of 2015, only 1.87% of Zambia's richest quintile were covered by social insurance programs, highlighting a gap in social safety nets for the wealthiest.

title: High Learning Poverty Rate
description: In 2019, 98.50% of Zambian children at the end of primary school were below minimum reading proficiency, adjusted for out-of-school children.

title: High Proportion of Pupils Below Minimum Reading Proficiency
description: In 2019, 98.24% of pupils in Zambia were below the minimum reading proficiency at the end of primary school, according to the low GAML threshold.

title: High Starting Age for Lower Secondary School
description: In 2023, Zambia had one of the highest starting ages for lower secondary school globally, set at 14 years.

title: High Expenditure on Primary Education
description: In 2017, Zambia allocated 67.35% of its government education expenditure to primary education, one of the highest proportions worldwide.

title: Minimal Out-of-Pocket Health Care Expenditure
description: In 2015, only 0.01% of Zambia's population spent more than 25% of their household consumption or income on out-of-pocket health care.

title: High Vitamin A Supplementation Coverage
description: In 2022, Zambia achieved a 97% coverage rate for Vitamin A supplementation among children aged 6-59 months, reflecting strong public health initiatives.

title: Balanced Sex Ratio at Birth
description: In 2023, Zambia maintained a balanced sex ratio at birth, with 1.011 male births per female birth, aligning closely with natural ratios.
